page.title: 05The Church
page.content: The parish church ,The Church of the Holy Rood,is just outside the study area.It is a thriving institution which was founded in the early 12 century.It still has a Norman tower but there have been many alterations through the years.There are 3 interesting early alabaster tomb stones inside the church.The church is built of local sandstone. The Methodist Chapel is in the High Street.It has a small congregation and is part of the Ashby Circuit.It is the only building in the area to be built of Charnwood Granites. There was once a Baptist Chapel in Mill Street.Its red brick building has been demolished and its graveyard cleared.
